newsitem.title: FINLAND: Telecom Finland wants all Finns to use Internet.
newsitem.headline: Telecom Finland wants all Finns to use Internet.

text.p: Finnish state-run telecommunications operator Telecom Finland said in a statement it aims to get all Finns to use the Internet.
It said it had agreed with Microsoft Corp to distribute Microsoft's Internet Explorer version 3.0 as its recommended Internet explorer.

"Telecom Finland's target is to get all Finns to use Internet services. We believe that our cooperation with Microsoft will lower the threshold for new users to step into the world of the internet," it said. @

Telecom Finland said a survey made by Taloustutkimus Oy showed that almost 400,000 Finns -- out of a population of five million -- used the internet every week and almost 150,000 used the net daily or almost every day in July-August.
"The biggest growth is at the place of work," it said.
Telecom Finland rival in internet services EuNet Finland said on August 1 it also promoted Microsoft's Explorer software.
